attr

public java.lang.Object attr(java.lang.String s)
Gets the value for the given attribute of the first view in the current selection. This is done using reflection, and as such expects a get- or is- prefixed method name for the view.

Parameters:
s - the name of the attribute to retrieve
Returns:
the value of the given attribute name on the first view in the current selection

attr

public $ attr(java.lang.String s,
              java.lang.Object o)

Parameters:
s - the name of the attribute to set
o - the value to set to the given attribute
Returns:
this

change

public $ change(Function function)
Registers common component changes

Parameters:
function - receives an instance of javaQuery with the changed view selected, as well as the following arguments:

  2. The associated event
Returns:
See Also:
$.changeEvent

val

public java.lang.Object val()
Get the value associated with the first view in the current selection. If the view is a JTextComponent, this method returns the String text. If it is a Button, the boolean selected state is returned. If it is a JLable, the Icon is returned.

Returns:
the value of this view, or null if not applicable.

val

public $ val(java.lang.Object object)
Set the value associated with the views in the current selection. If the view is a JTextComponent, this method sets the String text. If it is a Button, the boolean selected state is set. If it is an JLabel, the Icon (ImageIcon, BufferedImage, or String) is set. All other view types are ignored.

Returns:
this

Triggers a click event on the views in the current selection

click

public $ click(Function function)
Invokes the given Function every time each view in the current selection is clicked. The only parameter passed to the given function is a javaQuery instance containing the clicked view

Parameters:
function - the function to call when this view is clicked
Returns:
this

click

public $ click(java.lang.Object eventData,
               Function function)
Invokes the given Function for click events on each view in the current selection. The function will receive two arguments:
  1. a javaQuery containing the clicked view
  2. eventData

Parameters:
eventData - the second argument to pass to the function
function - the function to invoke
Returns:

each

public $ each(Function function)
Invokes the given function for each view in the current selection. Function receives a javaQuery instance containing the single view, and an integer of the current index

Parameters:
function - the function to invoke
Returns:
this

children

public $ children(Function function)
If the first view of the current selection is a subclass of AdapterView, this will loop through all the adapter data and invoke the given function, passing the varargs:
  1. the item from the adapter
  2. the index
Otherwise, if the first view in the current selection is a subclass of Container, each will loop through all the child views, and wrap each one in a javaQuery object. The invoked function will receive it, and an int for the index of the selected child view.

Parameters:
function - Function the function to invoke
Returns:
this

siblings

public $ siblings(Function function)
Loops through all the sibling views of the first view in the current selection, and wraps each in a javaQuery object. When invoked, the given function will receive two parameters:
  1. the javaQuery for the view
  2. the child index of the sibling

Parameters:
function - receives the javaQuery for the view, and the index for arg1

slice

public $ slice(int start)
Gets all the views in the current selection after the given start index

Parameters:
start - the starting position of the views to pass to the new instance of javaQuery.
Returns:
a javaQuery object containing the views from start to the end of the list.

slice

public $ slice(int start,
               int end)
Gets all the views in the current selection after the given start index and before the given end index

Parameters:
start - the starting position of the views to pass to the new instance of javaQuery.
Returns:
a javaQuery object containing the views from start to end.

all the selected views in a javaQuery wrapper

selectChildren

public $ selectChildren()
Selects the child views of the first view in the current selection

Returns:
a javaQuery Objects containing the child views. If the view is a subclass of AdapterView, the data of the javaQuery will be set to an Object[] of adapter items.

selectEmpties

public $ selectEmpties()
Select all non-Containers, or Containers with no children, that lay within the view hierarchy of the current selection

Returns:
a javaQuery object containing the selection

selectFocused

public $ selectFocused()
Selects the currently-focused view.

Returns:
a javaQuery Object created with the currently-selected View, if there is one

selectHidden

public $ selectHidden()
Select all invisible, gone, and 0-alpha views within the view hierarchy of the currently selected views

Returns:
a javaQuery Object containing the found views

selectVisible

public $ selectVisible()
Select all visible and 1-alpha views within the view hierarchy of the currenly selected views

Returns:
a javaQuery Object containing the found views

name

public $ name(java.lang.String name)
Set the current selection to the view with the given name

Parameters:
name - the name of the view to manipulate
Returns:
this

selectOnlyChilds

public $ selectOnlyChilds()
Selects all views within the current selection that are the single children of their parent views

Returns:
a javaQuery Object containing the found views.

selectParents

public $ selectParents()
Selects all views in the current selection that can contain other child views

Returns:
a javaQuery Object containing the found Containers

extend

public static void extend(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String clazz)
                   throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                          java.lang.SecurityException,
                          java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                          java.lang.InstantiationException,
                          java.lang.IllegalAccessException
Add an extension with the reference name

Parameters:
name - String used by the #ext(String) method for calling this extension
clazz - the name of the subclass of $Extension that will be mapped to name. Calling $.with(this).ext(myExtension); will now create a new instance of the given clazz, passing in this instance of $, then calling the invoke method.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if clazz is not a valid class name, or if it is not a subclass of $Extension.
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
java.lang.SecurityException
java.lang.IllegalAccessException
java.lang.InstantiationException

extend

public static void extend(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
                   throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                          java.lang.SecurityException,
                          java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
Add an extension with the reference name

Parameters:
name - String used by the #ext(String) method for calling this extension
clazz - subclass of $Extension that will be mapped to name. Calling $.with(this).ext(MyExtension.class); will now create a new instance of the given clazz, passing in this instance of $, then calling the invoke method.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if clazz is not a valid class name, or if it is not a subclass of $Extension.
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
java.lang.SecurityException
java.lang.IllegalAccessException
java.lang.InstantiationException

ext

public $Extension ext(java.lang.String extension,
                      java.lang.Object... args)
Load the extension with the name defined in extend(String, String)

Parameters:
extension - the name of the extension to load
Returns:
the new extension instance

write

public static void write(byte[] s,
                         java.lang.String fileName,
                         boolean append)
Write a byte stream to file

Parameters:
s - the bytes to write to the file
path - defines the save location of the file
append - true to append the new data to the end of the file. false to overwrite any existing file.
async - true if the operation should be performed asynchronously. Otherwise, false.

write

public static void write(java.lang.String s,
                         java.lang.String fileName,
                         boolean append)
Write a String to file

Parameters:
s - the String to write to the file
path - defines the save location of the file
append - true to append the new String to the end of the file. false to overwrite any existing file.
async - true if the operation should be performed asynchronously. Otherwise, false.

write

public static void write(java.lang.String s,
                         java.lang.String fileName,
                         boolean append,
                         java.lang.String notifySuccess,
                         java.lang.String notifyError)
Write a String to file, and execute functions once complete.

Parameters:
s - the String to write to the file
path - defines the save location of the file
append - true to append the new String to the end of the file. false to overwrite any existing file.
async - true if the operation should be performed asynchronously. Otherwise, false.
success - Function to invoke on a successful file-write. Parameters received will be:
  1. the String to write
  2. the File that was written (to)
error - Function to invoke on a file I/O error. Parameters received will be:
  1. the String to write
  2. the String reason

write

public static void write(byte[] s,
                         java.lang.String fileName,
                         boolean append,
                         java.lang.String notifySuccess,
                         java.lang.String notifyError)
Write a byte stream to file, and execute functions once complete.

Parameters:
s - the bytes to write to the file
path - defines the save location of the file
append - true to append the new bytes to the end of the file. false to overwrite any existing file.
async - true if the operation should be performed asynchronously. Otherwise, false.
notifySuccess - Notification to post with parameters on a successful file write. Parameters received will be:
  1. "data" : the byte[] to write
  2. "message" : a message
notifyError. - Notification to post with parameters on a failed file write. Parameters received will be:
  1. "data" : the byte[] to write
  2. "message" : a message

makeArray

public static JSONArray makeArray(java.lang.Object[] array)
Convert an Object Array to a JSONArray

Parameters:
array - an Object[] containing any of: JSONObject, JSONArray, String, Boolean, Integer, Long, Double, NULL, or null. May not include NaNs or infinities. Unsupported values are not permitted and will cause the JSONArray to be in an inconsistent state.
Returns:
the newly-created JSONArray Object

makeArray

public static java.lang.Object[] makeArray(JSONArray array)
Convert a JSONArray to an Object Array

Parameters:
array - the array to convert
Returns:
the converted array

map

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,?> map(java.lang.String json)
                                             throws JSONException
Converts a JSON String to a Map

Parameters:
json - the String to convert
Returns:
a Key-Value Mapping of attributes declared in the JSON string.
Throws:
JSONException - thrown if the JSON string is malformed or incorrectly written

map

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,?> map(JSONObject json)
                                             throws JSONException
Convert a JSONObject to a Map

Parameters:
json - the JSONObject to parse
Returns:
a Key-Value mapping of the Objects set in the JSONObject
Throws:
JSONException - if the JSON is malformed

map

public static java.util.Map<?,?> map(java.util.Map.Entry<?,?>... entries)
Shortcut method for creating a Map of Key-Value pairings. For example:
$.map($.entry(0, "Zero"), $.entry(1, "One"), $.entry(2, "Two"));

Parameters:
entries - the MapEntry Objects used to populate the map.
Returns:
a new map with the given entries
See Also:
entry(Object, Object)

entry

public static java.util.Map.Entry<?,?> entry(java.lang.Object key,
                                             java.lang.Object value)

Parameters:
key - the key
value - the value
Returns:
the Key-Value pairing Object
See Also:
#map(Entry...)

get

public static void get(java.lang.String url,
                       java.lang.Object data,
                       Function success,
                       java.lang.String dataType)
Shortcut method to use the default AjaxOptions to perform an Ajax GET request

Parameters:
url - the URL to access
data - the data to pass, if any
success - the Function to invoke once the task completes successfully.
dataType - the type of data to expect as a response from the URL. See AjaxOptions.dataType() for a list of available data types

getJSON

public static void getJSON(java.lang.String url,
                           java.lang.Object data,
                           Function success)
Shortcut method to use the default Ajax Options to perform an Ajax GET request and receive a JSON-formatted response

Parameters:
url - the URL to access
data - the data to send, if any
success - Function to invoke once the task completes successfully.

ScriptResponse}

ajaxPrefilter

public static void ajaxPrefilter(Function prefilter)
Handle custom Ajax options or modify existing options before each request is sent and before they are processed by $.ajax(). Note that this will be run in the background thread, so any changes to the UI must be made through a call to Activity.runOnUiThread().

Parameters:
prefilter - Function that will receive one Map argument with the following contents:
  • "options" : AjaxOptions for the request
  • "request" : HttpClient request Object

Setup global options

Parameters:
options -

ajaxKillAll

public static void ajaxKillAll()
Clears async task queue

load

public void load(java.lang.String url,
                 java.lang.Object data,
                 Function complete)
Load data from the server and place the returned HTML into the matched element

Parameters:
url - A string containing the URL to which the request is sent.
data - A plain object or string that is sent to the server with the request.
complete - A callback function that is executed when the request completes. Will receive two arguments: 1. response text, 2. text status

html

public $ html(java.lang.String html)
Include the html string the selected views. If a view has a setText method, it is used. Otherwise, a new TextView is created. This html can also handle image tags for both urls and local files. Local files should be the name (for example, for R.id.ic_launcher, just use ic_launcher).

Parameters:
html - the HTML String to include

text

public $ text(java.lang.String text)
Includes the given text string inside of the selected views. If a view has a setText method, it is used otherwise, if possible, a textview is added as a child to display the text.

Parameters:
text - the text to include

image

public $ image(java.awt.Image image)
Includes the given image inside of the selected views. If a view is an `ImageView`, its image is set. Otherwise, the background image of the view is set.

Parameters:
image - the drawable image to include
Returns:
this

image

public $ image(java.lang.String source)
For `ImageView`s, this will set the image to the given asset or url. Otherwise, it will set the background image for the selected views.

Parameters:
source - asset path, file path (starting with "file://") or URL to image
Returns:
this

image

public $ image(java.lang.String source,
               int width,
               int height,
               Function error)
For `ImageView`s, this will set the image to the given asset or url. Otherwise, it will set the background image for the selected views.

Parameters:
source - asset path, file path (starting with "file://") or URL to image
width - specifies the output bitmap width
height - specifies the output bitmap height
error - if the given source is a file or asset, this receives a javaQuery wrapping the current context and the Throwable error. Otherwise, this will receive an Ajax error.
Returns:
this
See Also:
AjaxOptions.error(Function)

image

public $ image(java.util.List<java.lang.String> sources)
Iterates through the selected views and sets the images to the given images (in order)

Parameters:
source - asset path, file path (starting with "file://") or URL to image
Returns:
this

image

public $ image(java.util.List<java.lang.String> sources,
               int width,
               int height,
               Function error)
Iterates through the selected views and sets the images to the given images (in order)

Parameters:
sources - the file paths or URLs to set
width - the output width of the image
height - the output height of the image
error - if the given source is a file or asset, this receives a javaQuery wrapping the current context and the Throwable error. Otherwise, this will receive an Ajax error.
Returns:
this
See Also:
AjaxOptions.error(Function)

Callbacks

public static Callbacks Callbacks()
A multi-purpose callbacks list object that provides a powerful way to manage callback lists. Registered callback functions will receive a null for their javaQuery variable. To receive a non-null variable, you must provide a Context.

Returns:
a new instance of Callbacks

setTimeout

public static java.util.Timer setTimeout(Function function,
                                         long delay)
Schedule a task for single execution after a specified delay.

Parameters:
function - the task to schedule. Receives no args. Note that the function will be run on a Timer thread, and not the UI Thread.
delay - amount of time in milliseconds before execution.
Returns:
the created Timer

setInterval

public static java.util.Timer setInterval(Function function,
                                          long delay)
Schedule a task for repeated fixed-rate execution after a specific delay has passed.

Parameters:
the - task to schedule. Receives no args. Note that the function will be run on a Timer thread, and not the UI Thread.
delay - amount of time in milliseconds before execution.
Returns:
the created Timer
